Reviews.Title: Good travel phone.  A decent value for the price.
Reviews.Author: Obscuron
Reviews.Content: I am a poor grad student and when my fancy android phone died, this was one of the few replacements I could afford.  Given the price, I was pleasantly surprised by how well it works.I think this phone is designed mainly as a second phone for travelers to take with them on vacation.  It has an extra SIM slot, so you can keep your main SIM in slot 1 and buy prepaid SIMs in airports to use in foreign countries.  The battery lasts for weeks so you could conceivably go for a whole vacation without having to find a plug adapter for your charger.  The flashlight feature might also conceivably come in handy when you're traveling.As a phone, it works great.  The buttons are big and feel durable.  Audio quality during calls is the best I've experienced in three or four phones. Because the battery is so big, the phone has a pleasant heft to it.The other features are very basic.  I haven't tried the camera or music player because I don't have a memory card and the phone has almost no on-board memory.The manual is pretty poor but you don't need it much because the phone is so simple.The only annoying factor is the texting interface.  There is no predictive text so you have to input one letter at a time.  I know this is how we used to do it back in 2000 or so, but it seems painfully slow after using modern phones.  If you don't text much this probably won't be a big deal for you.I would recommend this phone to two groups of people.  Either:  1)  You just need a reliable basic phone and don't have much money to spend.  2) You are going overseas and want a traveling phone so you can leave your expensive phone safe at home.  If either of these describes you then the Tank will probably be a pretty good bargain for you.

Reviews.Title: Good basic phone with some problems
Reviews.Author: First
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for one main reason - quad-band functionality plus price. It works fine as a good basic phone, but has some problems and room for improvement.Pros:1. Quad-band unlocked GSM phone with dual SIM.2. Long-lasting battery - very important plus.3. Good basic phone functionality.4. Flashlight is a plus.5. Powerful speakers.Cons:1. No 3.5 mm audio output, and Bluetooth does not connect to outside speakers.2. Phone Memory shows only 10 KB available - you can't save a single picture or a song unless you have SD card (the specifications actually say 16 MB of internal memory).3. The T190i version claims to have access to such social media as Facebook, Twitter, Yahoo, MSN etc. via a new menu option - Blu Club. Well, this Blu Club was empty on my phone without any possibility to access social media or internet. At the same time, GPRS connection was functioning and some data exchange was happening when I was visiting Blu Club option. It means that you are charged for the Data if you accidentally click on that option. I think it would be better just to leave it as a basic phone without Internet connection - that is where it is competitive.4. Tried for two weeks to get in touch with BluProducts Services department - no reply whatsoever.5. A few minor problems - the clock is unbelievably inaccurate unless it is updated over the air. The camera has such low resolution that appears to be useless for the present days. And active display could be a little bigger - over the entire window.One more suggestion. The quad-band functionality of this unlocked GSM phone with dual SIM slots brings it into the category of World (or International) phones. From that point of view, it would be nice to have an option to read several different languages, for example, in incoming SMS messages. There is no need for the entire phone programming linguistic support, but reading incoming information in a variety of languages is important, if it can be done.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great!
Reviews.Author: J. Lalor "Merlin"
Reviews.Content: The size, the color, the style, were all wonderful.  The included documentation wasn't phenomenal, but the phone doesn't do very much, so any reasonable person can figure it out after a little bit of playing around.Reception/Signal Strength was great.  The battery is insane!  Granted, the phone doesn't do much... but I turned the phone on on Tuesday morning, and it finally lost a block of battery life come Sunday.  That's with the phone being on the entire time, and making/receiving some calls and texts.  I probably could have gone my entire two week trip without recharging... just awesome!I used this phone for travel to the UK, using a prepaid SIM Card that I bought on Amazon (from Orange).  I'm planning to take this phone to every country I travel to, and do the same thing!

Reviews.Title: Great no nonsense phone but a little quirk
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: If you've been using a cell phone a long time, you'd recognize most of the features- think cell phone from the late 90's. Back then, screens were not color, there were no cameras, limited txt messaging, and whats a data plan?This phone is basic with some perks- it has a low end VGA camera, which is still kinda useful- especially if you are traveling and are afraid you might get lost, you can snap a quick pic of a street sign or some building for reference. It has a 8gb micro SD (not included) capability, so you can snap away for years and not fill it up. A basic LED light that will last for days on a full charge (if not a week), and an extremely large 1800mah battery. Due to its design, it intentionally doesn't have the uber touch screen (the biggest drain of smartphone battery), nor does it use 4g, LTE, HSPA, etc. (which is also a battery drainer). It basically has the same size battery of a smart phone. I have not tried downloading any "social media" apps. THey claim up to 30 day battery life, which at the rate its been going, seems totally possible.So some other "90's" tech- the phone book is not multi layered- remember back in the day, you would program "john home" "john work" and "john cell"? Then they made it so that you could just have "John" and 3 numbers? Ya, go back to the "home" "work" and "cell.". It also doesn't have t9 (motorola license I believe) input, so you will be pecking a lot for txt messaging.You also get some other great old tech- like buttons which work easily, super fast boot times (so you don't mind shutting it off), easy to read display, and superlight weight. The ringer is basic, but great- good because it isn't progressive, it can just be "loud".It is a true dual sim dual standby, from my testing- meaning that both lines will work simultaneously. This is cool in a number of ways- I won't get into it, but you can turn one off and one on. or both on. If both are on, it will prompt you for which sim to dial from after the number is entered. NOTE: It is not uncommon for battery time to be cut in half if both antennas are on. You should activate each sim separately when needed (especially useful for those who travel to foreign countries often).Now for the not so good- and why it looses one star:the keypad lock works- but its not intuitive. Takes a little getting used to, but it does let you reprogram it- sorta. still figuring it out.The display will come on as long as the button is pressed. So you could still drain your battery.THe FM radio requires a proprietary usb headset- I will not be investigating this function. (the Jenny TV uses analog TV, so is pretty much a no go in the U.S.)The charger uses Mini USB- except the world has more or less moved on mostly to Micro- not a big deal, as I've probably got 10 or 12 mini USB chargers around.

Reviews.Title: Elderly user finds it loud enough
Reviews.Author: Crema
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my father who wanted a LOUD phone but did not need a data-plan smartphone. He says the volume is loud enough for him. It has a good amount of features for the price, although he isn't using them. There is no booklet provided or information online about the phone, a negative, but he managed to figure things out by playing around.

Reviews.Title: It is charmed with to my grandmother, because it is resistant to the blows
Reviews.Author: Ramos Franklin E.
Reviews.Content: Buy it for my grandfather, it is something basic, but it is charmed with to my grandmother, because it is resistant to the blows

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!
Reviews.Author: David Dohi
Reviews.Content: Works well, reliable, good reception too.  Much better communication that unreliable VoIP in Europe!  We used this with the One Sim Card international SIM card.

Reviews.Title: Lasted about 3 months
Reviews.Author: Damian Forsythe
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my mother, who needed something basic but with Bluetooth.  The good aspects of the phone are that the buttons are big and legible for older folks, and it seemed to work fine for calling.  She was even able to pair the phone by herself to her Ford SYNC system.However, the phone up and died about 3 months in.  Just a dead, blank screen.  That's when I found out that ALL CLAIMS OF A WARRANTY ARE COMPLETELY BOGUS!!!!!!!  It was after the 30 day Amazon return period, so I contacted the manufacturer about it, only to be informed that the seller is responsible for warranty claims.  They DIRECTLY REFUSED to tell me the terms of the warranty.  You will find that NEITHER the documentation you get with the phone, NOR the product page on Amazon, ACTUALLY DETAILS THE TERMS OF THE WARRANTY.  So, there really isn't a warranty.  Fortunately for me, Amazon accepted a return for refund anyway.  But, you should consider this to be strictly a disposable, warranty-free item.

Reviews.Title: Useful for those who travel overseas, but POOR customer service
Reviews.Author: Bill "superbidder"
Reviews.Content: I travel to South America and Europe often. I've purchased a SIM cards there that I can use with this phone without having to remove my US carrier card.For the last 2 weeks I have been trying to contact the customer service - sales@bluproducts.com. I need to purchase a second battery, it would be nice to know the reference for the battery. I haven't been lucky, they just sent another URL (24hrsdeals.com), but the battery was nowhere to find in this seller catalog.  Newegg.com also sells this phone but they have no clue whatsoever what battery fits the phone.Good luck if your battery runs out of juice!!!

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the world traveler
Reviews.Author: Tanya Cox
Reviews.Content: I am in Malaysia right now and it works great with the SIM card here. Easy and cheap for the world traveler that does not want to pay for an international plan from your carrier in the US/Canada. Pop in the SIM and away you go. I can call forever on $10 SIM card to the US. All you need to do is buy an international SIM card in the country once you arrive (you usually have to register the card so they will ask for your passport). You can find them everywhere. Pop out the SIM card and put in phone - turn on phone and you are ready to go. Recharge by buying a prepay plan - type in the code.

Reviews.Title: Nice but cheap problem to lock it
Reviews.Author: Yuval
Reviews.Content: The phone has 2 sims that can serve for other countries (GSM) or different plans - all together No need to carry two cellularsHowever, it feels cheap (and indeed it is just 30-32 dollar) and very limitedIt is just to make calls and send SMS - which it does OK - not a smartphone or suchBattery hold long hours and the sound is OKSo, when you buy it make sure you know its abilitiesFor what it suppose to do, it is OKhad problems when the screen is locked but any touch makes it active

Reviews.Title: perfect for what you need it.
Reviews.Author: LoloBleue
Reviews.Content: All I needed it for is texting and calling.  Other features are a gravy.  it has two slots for sim cards, so you can place an US carrier sim card on one and an international on the other, or simply another.  Delivery was prompt, and price wasn't bad. Rings, tomes, and calls come in crisp and distinct.If all you need is talk and text, and bluetooth for earphones this is it.

Reviews.Title: Necessary evil
Reviews.Author: Peter J. Van Zweeden
Reviews.Content: Thanks to ATT's failure to provide coverage in Europe I discovered the need for a quad band equipped cell phone, so this one seemed ok.A bit hard to learn the in and outs for the few calls I needed to make, however it beats not having any phone at all.  You will go blind trying to find a public phone in Europe.You still will have to go and buy a local chip/contract to make this work, so although the phone is cheap and works, operating it is not inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: great basic phone
Reviews.Author: bill
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a basic GSM unlocked phone at a cheap price this is the phone. Have used it in Europe and Africa with no problems. Dual sim lets me keep my ATT sim active in the phone while buying cheap prepaid sims wherever I travel. The phone is very basic, I just use it for calls and basic texting, nothing more. Battery is massive, lasting up to a week without charging. Only drawback is  you have to keep the keypad locked (press center key than * key) while in pocket. Manual is useless, just play with the phone till you get the hang of it....

Reviews.Title: Very good phone for young children.
Reviews.Author: B. America "Jeranderson"
Reviews.Content: I started my son out with this phone. He thought it was cool and sounded pretty with his music.No one else in school had this phone he said. Now he has a BLU smartphone and loves that even more.

Reviews.Title: Not so simple a cell phone to operate ! ..user manual very vague to understand ..too many " bells and whistles " ! !
Reviews.Author: Robert Reyes "radio head"
Reviews.Content: ...difficult to program ..user manual very vague ..not a as simple as advertised ..too many " bells and whistles ".

Reviews.Title: Huge battery, but I still don't like it
Reviews.Author: PhotoMEX
Reviews.Content: I am still not sure if this is inexpensive or just cheap. I wouldn't buy it again, but that's just me. I don't need 2 SIM slots.Pros:* Incredibly long lasting battery - this is a big plus* 2 SIM slotsCons:* Very cheap look and feel* Doesn't feel nice, vibrates unpleasantly* Even when it's locked the keys beep when you press them. So if you carry it in the pocket of your tight jeans it will start beeping. This is pretty annoying.

Reviews.Title: Bad sound is your thing?
Reviews.Author: furg
Reviews.Content: Get this phone as a back up phone ONLY. after light use the sound Q. drops so badly u think you've dropped the call, but battery life is outstanding, thus the backup comment.

Reviews.Title: good value, but weird.
Reviews.Author: K. Miller
Reviews.Content: Works fine for the money. The interface is just as screwy as one might expect from the price, but the phone works. I was not able to use the bluetooth, but did not try that hard. The biggest annoyance is that when you lock the keypad and put it in your pocket, it beeps every time you bend over. Very annoying. So I put it in a pouch and it's fine now.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Rubén Astudillo.
Reviews.Content: a good response to my request, I am pleased to acquire products that easy to go straight to my home or office without so many complications ...

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: cesar becerra
Reviews.Content: this phone is good for no internet and fast texting users, only for calls and occasional texting, strong speaker, easy to use, long lasting battery its ok.

Reviews.Title: Everything great except beeping
Reviews.Author: Jess R.
Reviews.Content: This phone is just what you'd expect: cheap, quad-band, functional, not particularly great interface.  It gets the job done, but you'll spend a few minutes fussing with it to set the options up correctly.The one thing I can't understand for the life of me is that, although you can choose to silence the annoying "beep" sounds every time you press a button on the phone while you're using it, you *can't* silence the beep when the lock screen is on.  That means that the #1 time you wouldn't want to hear beeps---when the phone is just getting randomly bumped in your pocket---you hear the constantly.  As soon as you unlock the screen, the buttons stop making noise (assuming you chose this setting).  It's just baffling.  Why would anyone want to hear the buttons beep when the lock screen is on?

Reviews.Title: Good for my Grandmother
Reviews.Author: MA
Reviews.Content: We needed a phone for my grandmother that was loud & had large keys. This phone has both. We just popped her SIM card in, and it worked on AT&T.; Very, very easy. Similar function to that of the older cell phones I had in the early 2000's. So far, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: almost good
Reviews.Author: lamomma
Reviews.Content: Sound and battery life are good, but some features are lacking. This phone does not have a predicitve typing feature. My last phone, when I began to type a number, would show a list of matches. This phone does not.  Also, while battery life is decent, the battery drops from 1 bar to empty quickly and without warning. Other phones beep when the battery is low, this one just shuts off, and I have missed calls.

Reviews.Title: Battery lasted 27 day with really low usage
Reviews.Author: nskmda
Reviews.Content: First of all, its a real cheap phone and you should lower your expectations upfront.A general note: I'm only a basic phone features user. I don't text, don't use camera of the phone, don't use it's data access capabilities, don't use Facebook/Twitter/other crappy sites from the phone.So, for $24 I believe it's a good phone which serves its basic purpose: make and receive calls.What I liked:* the phone buttons are big,* numbers on the phone buttons are big,* reception was good,* it's unlocked and works with any GSM provider,* it supports custom MP3 ringtones,* call sound quality was fine with me and loud enough.* size is actually good for me - not too small, but not too big. I was afraid it would be bigger but no.* battery life is pretty good. I charged the phone completely on the 1st day of the month. On the 27th it showed empty battery charge indicator. I only made total of 45-50 minutes of calls and received about 15 test text messages. To me, with such usage and battery capacity it should last at least a full month. So, the battery life may be 'awesome' compared to an overloaded smartphone, but my opinion - only 'pretty good' (like 4.5 out of 5).I haven't tried its quad-band 2-SIM capabilities yet nor I use cell phone cameras. So, no comments on those features.What I didn't like (though minor and thus the rating is still 4 stars):* regardless of where I kept the phone (in a belt case or in a pocket) I kept accidentally 'press' the dial buttons. This made the phone wake up and affected battery life.* when the phone is in 'standby' you can't say if it's completely off - no indicators.* no phone memory. You have to buy an SD card (my 8 Gb card was perfectly recognized by the phone).* no way to change incoming text message notification sound* limited/unclear system configuration menuYes, it looks cheap. May be it breaks in a few months (but I don't think it will happen if you don't drop it). Yes, the screen is small but to dial a number it's absolutely fine (digits are big enough even for elderly, I believe).Yes, the user manual leaves a lot to desire. But when I played with the phone menu for a few minutes I was able to configure all the features I need for myself. Not even reading the manual at all. Yes, the menus are really simplified (as the phone itself), but what do you expect today for under $25?Again, overall I would confirm another reviewer's opinion that it's a good back up phone (especially for travelers). And I'm actually using it as a primary one.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, Basic - Worth $25
Reviews.Author: Sam Yahm
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for one thing - to make phone calls with an unlocked quadband phone overseas.  I have not traveled with it, but I'm assuming it can handle the phone call portion fine.  It is the rest of the package that is irritating.BLU made some seriously strange decisions.There is no dedicated volume rocker, to change the volume of the ringer or call, but it can play music and has a flashlight.  To use either of these options you need to scroll though a long list of options.The hardware seems fine, but the software is out of Motorola circa 1999.Is it worth $25, hell yes!Do I like this phone - no way.Would I recommend it to someone else for $25- certainly.Do I wish someone made a $25 phone that was easy to use... dearly.

Reviews.Title: A Good Deal
Reviews.Author: LarrySpring
Reviews.Content: I purchased this BLU T190 Tank Unlocked Quad-Band GSM Phone via Amazon.  I put in the AT&T; Sim card. At first I could not make calls although the phone saw my SIM. I tried a couple of times and it works now with instant/excellent help from Gus, a BLU rep. I was told phones sometimes have issues with an old SIM. The phone is rich in features and is a very good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: The Tanks I bought will not charge and operate
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these Blu Tank T190i phones from Amazon. Only one time was I able to charge either phone up to operational level, and then the phones were only operational one time for about three weeks each. Many times after that, I tried to charge them either using the Blu USB charger or my computer USB port. The phones showed as charged, and then when I unplugged them, they would not respond to keypad presses and turn on. When I plugged them back into their chargers, they showed as charging again even though the display showed they were fully charged prior to unplugging.Most likely, this was a battery problem, but I had no way of knowing that for certain. I emailed Blu's customer support, and all they would say is that if it's beyond Amazon's return period, they can't do anything about it. They offered NO troubleshooting or repair suggestions, even in response to specific questions. I even asked them if they have had any similar Blu Tank problem reports, and they did not respond. I did not wish to buy $9 replacement batteries without knowing whether this fix will work, so I tossed these phones in the trash and bought better quality phones, the Samsung GT-E1182L bar phones.I recommend that you look at phones other than these Blu Tanks.

Reviews.Title: poor os
Reviews.Author: Gift Card "t     j"
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get a backup phone for when I go snowboarding.  Popped my sim card in and it works, but I couldn't understand how to save contacts and when you text it doesn't predict your text.  So I returned it'

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Fast delivery.
Reviews.Author: Buckshot
Reviews.Content: good quality from a fairly unknown manufacturer. very basic no internet or other useless extras, good for people who just want to talk  and text. the quality of product for the price is hard to beat, could get it cheaper elsewhere if your willing to look around.

Reviews.Title: Not so good product to buy
Reviews.Author: Harshad
Reviews.Content: The construction lacks many basic feature you would like to see even at this throw away price.1. No GPRS2. No ring tone selection3. No audio headphone jack4. No in built radio antenna. You would not be able to use the radio if signal strength is even little bit of weak.5. Aesthetically it looks awkward from key board to back cover opening .

Reviews.Title: Does the job.
Reviews.Author: Parrotheadjoe
Reviews.Content: I don't expect a lot of these phones so what I received is what I expected. These phones are sturdy and well made but are quiet simple to operate. However, that being said, there is a learning curve so don't think you will simply insert a SIM card and be making calls moments later. Take a moment to look over the owner's manual just to get a sense of the phone's operation. You will certainly save yourself a lot of time by reviewing the manual. I have owned a lot of phones over the last twenty years and I found this phone to be pretty much in line with lower end cell phones. But this is a dual SIM phone and therefor requires a few more settings than your typical cell phone. Read the manual! You WILL have to input your PIN number every time you cycle your phone on and off.I had a few problems while using this phone but must admit some of this was due to the SIM card I was using. Make sure to select a good SIM card for the phone and the region you are going to.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work
Reviews.Author: ROGER EDWARDS
Reviews.Content: Ordered next day and received it next day. Item was poorly packaged and minimally secure. Seal was broken and phone does not work properly. Ordered replacement and it had the exact same problem.

Reviews.Title: Didn't like it.
Reviews.Author: Jeanne O'Neil
Reviews.Content: I originally bought it specifically for my recent trip to the Netherlands.  I Used a Sim card for Europe. It never worked well despite trying to make calls in various places. to include Amsterdam.  Was only able to get through twice despite multiple attempts.  When they actually went through, my husband couldn't understand half of what I said.  Would not recommend it.  Not worth the money'J. O'Neil - Hartford CT
